name: Kepler-277
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-277 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-277 is a star with 1.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.69 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-277 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-277 system


Kepler-277 b

Kepler-277 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-277 b is 87.45 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-277 b is 2.92 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-277 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-277 c

Kepler-277 c was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-277 c is 64.236 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-277 c is 3.36 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-277 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-277, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
